body_content.explanation: something that you do, or a thing that you give someone, that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect:
examples: As a token of our gratitude for all that you have done, we would like you to accept this small gift.
It doesn't have to be a big present - it's just a token.

body_content.explanation: a piece of paper, a card, or an electronic document with a particular amount of money shown on it that can be exchanged in a shop or online for goods of that value:
examples: He always bought me tokens for a department store for my birthday.

body_content.explanation: a round metal or plastic disc that can be used instead of money :
examples: Metal tokens are used instead of cash in some slot machines in casinos.
First they had to queue up to receive a small plastic token, which they could then exchange for food.

body_content.explanation: a piece of data that is used to represent and replace another one, in order to prevent private information being seen by someone who is not allowed to do so:
examples: When we receive the transaction securely, we tokenize it and send back a token to the merchant so they never have to see a card number for settlement.

body_content.explanation: a unit of language that is used in a particular text :
examples: The participants produced 1,564 linguistic tokens, of which 1,021 (65%) were marked for plural.
Types are the distinct words in a text, whereas tokens are all the words, including repeats.

body_content.explanation: used to describe an action, an amount, etc. that is intended to represent something or to show that you are doing something, even if is very small or has a small effect:
examples: The troops in front of us either surrendered or offered only token (= not much) resistance.
The company was bought by the government for a token 1p a share.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to something that is done to in order to appear to support, help, or represent a particular group of people, but that does not help that group of people in a lasting or important way:
examples: The truth is that they appoint no more than a token number of women to managerial jobs.
When just one woman is on a company's board she may be dismissed as the token female.
I felt like a token Black person on the committee.
